pros: La Salle University is like a big family, guided by the values of the Christian Brothers. Your coworkers are happy to offer you guidance and support.
cons: The pay is low even by adjuncting standards. You can find yourself working basically full-time hours for very part-time compensation.

pros: Really great students to work with.
cons: Administration is challenging to work with however. Average benefits, low pay, and no parental leave outside of the standard FMLA.

review_title: Jury is Out - May be on the way of becoming a good employer, or may not
pros:
- It is good that the University is implementing a JEDI / Diversity & Inclusion initiative. If the initiative succeeds, this can go a long way in inspiring healing. And retaining a diverse staff, and recognition and advancement of talented, qualified staff - especially women and minorities.

- If you are passionate about education - an opportunity to make a contribution to help first-generation students, and others who want to change their lives and advance professionally.

 -Tuition benefits if you'd like to pursue an education.
cons:
-If you are passionate about education - it can be frustrating and sad to witness mismanagement, and to navigate a culture that can be resistant to change and where opportunities very frequently go untapped.

-Very challenging for women, even in leadership to advance or be heard.

-Perceived instability from articles may make it difficult to attract people.

-Rapid turnover, even of new hires can make it difficult to partner and advance initiatives.

-Easy burnout, entrenched culture makes it difficult to promote best practices and needed technologies.

-Talented employees will often have to pick up the slack for deficiencies in existing staff.

review_title: Solid part time job for students
pros: Flexible hours that avoid class conflicts
cons: Don't get paid that much

Professional & friendly staff
cons: Some of the surrounding areas, be careful. Like in any major city use common sense.

job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Great place to work with lots of career advancement
cons: No negatives - great environment and workplace

pros: Enjoy working there and the people are great
cons: Long hours and tough financial landscape

pros: A lot of time off with flexible hours in the summer. Friendly atmosphere. Tuition remission.
cons: Low pay with very little room for growth given the financial situation. For a catholic university, this place is very immoral. They have made many benefit cuts and have let go or outsourced low paid employees to "save money" from their > 10mil debt crisis yet continue to bend over backwards for their higher end employees (even if they get tossed, they are still left with a VERY nice severance package). There is no organization amongst the departments. Each department does whatever they want. Lack of communication between all departments therefore money is lost and employees/ students get frustrated. I am not only a former employee but I am an alumni. If I knew how this placed works before I went there, I would have never wanted to attend there nor will I ever send my children or for that fact "my DOG" there.

job_title: Student Affairs Professional in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Very friendly coworkers. Clear and flexible power dynamics. The university let me try out new things and take on responsibilities that I created for myself. They let you make your job and work with students unlike any other university. For example, I worked with faculty, staff, and students to help maintain and facilitate a community garden on campus. The dedication of faculty and their outwardness to staff is great, and is emblematic of the kind of culture that La Salle has.
cons: Like any university, its hard to move up the ladder without going to another college. La Salle, nevertheless, is a great stepping stone for a budding career. For the university or student affairs professional, the abundance of colleges in the area makes La Salle and the surrounding community a great place to work.

review_title: Great school, but limited opportunities for growth and earning a  higher salary
pros: The atmosphere is pleasant and laid back depending on which department you work in.  The University offers many perks, such as summer Fridays off, substantial vacation/sick time, holiday breaks, flexibility, tuition remission, and great people to work with.  The University is very caring and focuses on the students and the neighboring community.
cons: While working for La Salle has many perks, there are not many opportunities for growth or for earning a higher salary.  Also, like many small private universities, change is slow-going and when it comes to being competitive, La Salle is somewhat behind the rest of the schools in the area.

pros: Academic, professional and cordial atmosphere.
cons: Lack of budget resources for new initiatives, innovation and updating of processes and infrastructure. A downturn in enrollment necessitated cuts of at least 29 professional administrative staff.  Early retirement was also initiated, which many people took advantage of.  Costs continue to rise and short term enrollment projections are not positive.

review_title: Revolving Faculty Door:  Nursing Faculty don't stay too long!
pros: If you like to work hard for low pay and not be appreciated for long hours, no personal life this is the place for you.
cons: No support from Dean of Nursing. Students Rule, Nursing faculty are considered expendable. Ask how many have left in the past 2 years- qualified and dedicated staff.  Pressure on Faculty to pass failing and marginal students. HIGH CRIME AREA.

review_title: Great People and a fun, fast paced environment
pros:
-Working in athletics provides outside of the job perks (sporting events, apparel, etc).
-excellent benefits
-good people
-a good stepping stone to a higher-level athletic program
cons:
-long hours and many weekends and nights
-low compensation
-lack of synergy between different departments
-facilities are not the best

pros: Benefits and benefits about average.
cons: No growth opportunities and no employee values. Limited direction from management and negativity abounds toward employees. Tuition is extremely high with very low compensation for employees in all fields of education and business areas for a large well known university in a major city. Revenue bonds were purchased for over 101 million in 2012.

review_title: Treated well and fair...mostly everyone is helpful
pros: There is always something different to work on and something new that comes your way.  Therefore, very seldom get "bored"...good community...fits well into schedule
cons: The internet is very sketchy which makes it somewhat difficult to do work at times...outdated office space makes it feel some trapped.

pros: The teachers really car about student sucess
cons: Upper managment is abysmal and lacks care and empathy for staff and faculty

pros: Friendly Staff and Professors from all Departments throughout the University. Good Library as well. Good dining services and IT support.
cons: Parking facilities for Faculty and Staff is horrible. There is no way to get a parking spot unless you show up at 6:00 am in the morning.

review_title: La Salle University needs to provide better support and re-examine its objectives.
pros: Facilities were updated and helpful for classroom instruction.
cons: No training or support for new employees; poorly defined objectives for both educational and business .

pros: Amazing environment with help ready to help. As a part time worker I was compensated for any additional work done over what was accepted.
cons: Nothing bad to say I love the environment and the students
